question.title: Eclipse will not run files from other people
question.body:
I am having difficulty accessing student java files/projects. When I open the files I am always asked to run with an ANT build (don't know what that means) and it will not run. If I copy the code and create a new project it works fine, so there is nothing wrong with code, but I want to be able to open and run students work directly. I have looked at another question about this but did not understand any of the answers. Can anyone provide any direction please?

I have tried opening the files and it asks for an ANT build. I have created a new project and opened the file into the new project, and again was asked for the ANT build. I have copied the code into a new black project and file and everything works.

I am accessing the files by simply going to File-->Open File and selecting the files that I want. They are all Java files. This is a picture of tree on the left and code headings across the top.

answers.body: "delete module-info.java at your Project Explorer tab" is what I needed to do.

question_comments.body: Are the student works individual, self-contained Java files (no dependencies/non-standard imports) that you want to compile and run in Eclipse like with javac and java from command line? That should be possible, too, if you right-click on the files (in some parent project) and select "run". Show your project structure and how exactly you try to run them.
Which files do you open how? Be aware that there are several ways to open or import files or projects. Please provide a minimal reproducible example.

Share the project structure (files and hidden files) (try using the tree command on it). It is likely that the students projects has the hidden eclipse files on it from their environment which is messing with yours. Ant = Apache Ant it is a build tool read its documentation.
Eclipse is designed for individual work. How to Execute and Run Java Code from the Terminal

79618442.body: Hello shodai, there is no need to apologize for asking questions on this website. Good questions are considered a positive contribution, not a nuisance. Answering your own question is also good.
